result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justina Lynn Blackdeer

records.addlTxt:
OFF THE RECORD / 10:40 AM Defendant Justina Lynn Blackdeer not in court.  DEF located in Taycheedah.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Justina Lynn Blackdeer.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attny request plea/sentencing hearing to be set.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 24, 2023 at 01:00 pm.

11:46 AM Defendant Justina Lynn Blackdeer appeared by video, in custody.   Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Justina Lynn Blackdeer.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt  indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.  State calls witness,  Deputy Kevin Hagmann, sworn in by Clerk Torstenson.  State begins examination.  11:51 AM  Witness identified the DEF, Attny Thomas-Schmidt no objection, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination. 11:54 AM   State tenders witness.  11:54 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Thomas-Schmidt. 11:57 AM Attny Thomas-Schmidt no further questions.  No argument by either party.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:19 AM  Defendant Justina Blackdeer in court, in custody appears by video.  Attorney Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt appears by video.  Bruce Poquette appears for the State of WI.   Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Thomas-Schmidt makes bond argument for modification.  State objects to any bond changes.  Court denies bond modification.

11:22 AM Defendant Justina Lynn Blackdeer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Justina Lynn Blackdeer.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Attny request to have preliminary hearing.   Attny Thomas-Schmidt request bond motion.  DEF makes statement to court.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
